channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Biden will be president-elect today, but Trump plans new stunt
item.description: Democrat Joe Biden will be confirmed as president-elect Monday, as the Electoral College certifies the election result, but President Donald Trump has a new strategy to prolong reality.

item.title: There's no business like SNOW business! Village shops decorate their windows with wintry scenes
item.description: Hartley Wintney in Hampshire has been transformed into a Winter Wonderland, with 35 shop windows decorated using just a regular can of Snow Spray and a dry paint brush in just three days.

item.title: WSJ opinion editor defends 'kiddo' op-ed about Dr. Jill Biden
item.description: The Wall Street Journal's opinion editor, Paul Gigot, has defended an op-ed piece that called on America's incoming first lady, Jill Biden, to drop the use of her doctor title.

item.title: FSB assassins 'were behind Navalny poison attack'
item.description: Maria Pevchikh was seen on surveillance footage leaving Moscow with her bags packed - and was still being shadowed by the FSB when she arrived in Siberia, according to the investigation by Bellingcat .

item.title: Meghan Markle gifts Oprah Winfrey a hamper full of coffee blends to mark 'first day of Christmas'
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex, 39, has invested in her first startup business, Clevr Blends, according to Fortune. The royal's close friend Oprah Winfrey showed off a box of the products online today

item.title: Jesy Nelson announces she is leaving Little Mix after nine years
item.description: The singer, 29, took to Instagram on Monday night to share a heartfelt statement where she revealed she wants to focus on things that make her 'happy'.

item.title: Sacked Eton teacher LOSES appeal: College UPHOLDS decision to axe tutor in 'toxic masculinity' row
item.description: The governing body of the £42,500-a-year Berkshire school today upheld the decision of bosses to sack Will Knowland after he refused to take down his lecture 'The Patriarchy Paradox'.

item.title: Matt Hancock blames new strain of coronavirus for surging cases in London and the South East
item.description: There have been reports of the strain in at least 60 local authority areas in England and it is believed to be similar to ultra-infectious variants racing through Europe, Mr Hancock claimed.

item.title: Family of missing hiker who vanished in the Pyrenees three weeks ago issue desperate plea
item.description: Esther Dingley went missing three weeks ago while hiking in the Pyrenees. Her partner and mother have implored anyone who might know what happened to come forward.

item.title: London goes into Tier 3: Matt Hancock confirms city will go into toughest lockdown from Wednesday
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock told the Commons that the tough new rules will come into effect in the capital just after midnight on Wednesday morning - less than 48 hours time.

item.title: Space: Arachnids in orbit weave webs in microgravity using LIGHT as a reference point
item.description: In their natural habitat on the planet's surface, our eight-legged friends weave webs that are slightly asymmetrical - with their centre slightly closer to the upper edge, due to gravity.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Michelin-starred restaurateur hits out at new London Tier 3 lockdown
item.description: David Moore of Pied à Terre in Fitzrovia said the move 'feels like Armageddon' and admitted that he feels like 'crying' as he accused Matt Hancock of 'acting without any rhyme nor reason'.

item.title: SCAM ALERT: There's been a 603% rise in fake DVLA emails and texts
item.description: The DVLA on Monday shared a selection of the examples of emails and texts motorists had received in recent months from fraudsters pretending to be the government agency.

item.title: Asda is forced to hire more security guards as it prepares for huge surge in Christmas panic buyers
item.description: The supermarket chain said it will be deploying extra security on the doors of all its 421 large superstores across the UK between December 19 and December 24.

item.title: Get ready for Tony Blair - the Opera: New musical will be staged next year
item.description: The rock opera will be performed at The Turbine Theatre, at Battersea Power Station, in February next year as part of MTFestUK 2021. The theatre says it will play 'fast and loose with facts'.

item.title: Three people have their hands cut off by Mexican cartel 'for stealing'
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: A woman aged 22 and two men aged 23 and 25 were found dumped by the side of a highway in central Mexico with their hands hacked off.

item.title: Ex-girlfriend says teenager, 19, confessed to killing 15-year-old with wrench in woods
item.description: The ex-girlfriend of Matthew Mason, a teenager accused of murdering fellow teen Alex Rodda, has told Chester Crown Court that he broke down in tears and confessed to the killing.

item.title: Amazon's self-driving car company reveals its autonomous 'carriage-style' robotaxi
item.description: Amazon's newly acquired self-driving car company Zoox has just unveiled its autonomous robotaxi that is designed with carriage-style seating for up to four passengers and hits speeds of 75mph.

item.title: Antibiotic azithromycin is DROPPED from RECOVERY trial
item.description: The findings come from the RECOVERY trial led by the University of Oxford which assesses more than 20,000 severe Covid-19 cases at 176 different NHS hospitals in the UK.

item.title: Ministers plan ban on gas boilers in new homes from 2025
item.description: Boris Johnson's green energy revolution could spell the end of gas boilers in new homes from 2025 as the Government aims to replace them with hydrogen and heat pumps.

item.title: Zsa Zsa Gabor's canary-yellow former Bel Air mansion sold to diamond mogul billionaire for $16M
item.description: Zsa Zsa Gabor - known for her femme fatale roles, many marriages and arrest for slapping a police officer - bought the home in 1973 for $245,000 and lived there until her death in 2016, at age 99.

item.title: Cops believe Gilgo Beach serial killer cherry-picked victims for their petite frames
item.description: Ten years after a cadaver dog uncovered the body of Melissa Barthelemy near Gilgo Beach, Long Island, police appear to be no closer to arresting the serial killer responsible for at least 10 deaths.

item.title: Empty vial and syringe from the world's first Covid-19 vaccination saved by Science Museum
item.description: On December 8, a 90-year-old grandmother in Coventry became the first person in the world to receive a Covid-19 vaccine outside of clinical trials.

item.title: Sweden's Icehotel reveals its new one-of-a-kind suites for 2020
item.description: Each year since 1989, the Icehotel has been built and rebuilt using just snow and ice in the village of Jukkasjarvi, 125 miles north of the Arctic Circle next to the shores of the Torne River.

item.title: Wildfires in the Arctic Circle and western US reached 'unprecedented intensity' in 2020
item.description: While 2020 was one of the lowest years for active fires globally, fire intensity has been far higher in the worst affected areas, according to the EU's Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service.

item.title: BASE jumpers leap off 650ft mountain on broomsticks in stunt inspired by Harry Potter Quidditch game
item.description: Footage shows BASE jumper Antony Newton and friends launching themselves from the 200m mountain, in the Lauterbrunnen area of the Swiss Alps.

item.title: Will Young tells inquest caring for 'suicidal' brother became 'too much'
item.description: Singer Will Young, 41, told Poplar Coroners Court he was his twin brother Rupert's carer before it 'became too much'. Rupert later killed himself jumping off of Westminster Bridge in central London.

item.title: Father of Everton fan Rhys Jones, who died aged 11 in 2007, hits back at Chelsea fan who mocked him
item.description: Everton fan and season ticket holder Jones was murdered at the age of 11 after being shot by Sean Mercer in Liverpool in 2007, rocking the entire community.

item.title: Moment Mount Etna eruption sends a stream of lava and smoke 328 feet into the air over Sicily
item.description: An eruption at Mount Etna Sunday night sent a dense ash plume three miles high and lava fountains rising more than 325 feet into the air. Volcanic ash covered cars, streets and homes in nearby villages.

item.title: Two career criminals who murdered a 61-year-old man by torturing him to death are jailed for life
item.description: Craig Stanton, 43, and Alexander Mackay, 47, broke into Saleem Butt's house in Batley, West Yorkshire, looking for cash and drugs on April 24 and tortured him to death.

item.title: Pfizer CEO doesn't want to 'jump the line' to get firm's vaccine
item.description: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla said he will get the vaccine as soon as possible, but doesn't want to create the impression that executives get priority - but says polls show people would trust it most if he got the shot.

item.title: Fishermen rescue turtle from jaws of a tiger shark after it tries to climb aboard their boat
item.description: Kai Survance, from Green Turtle Cay, Bahamas, and his friend were fishing in a boat off the coast of Abaco when they saw the tiger shark locking its jaws around the turtle's body.

item.title: Aston Hall victims receive apology after doctor abused 130 children as young as 10
item.description: Victims of a vile doctor who preyed on vulnerable children at Aston Hall psychiatric hospital, Derby, in the 1960s and 1970s have received an apology from Health Secretary Matt Hancock.

item.title: Lottie Moss APOLOGISES for declaring she was a 'COVID super-spreader'
item.description: Lottie Moss declared she was 'super-spreading COVID' as she put on a cosy display with her friends during an Instagram Live on Saturday.

item.title: Beautiful image of a giraffe among the winners of this year's Nature Photographer awards
item.description: The winner was Italian photographer Roberto Marchegiani. His winning shot was of a giraffe emerging from the forest in Lake Nakuru, Kenya, during the rainy season.

item.title: Manchester bomber Salman Abedi gave taxi driver a Koran saying 'Please pray for me brother'
item.description: Manchester bomber Salman Abedi handed the gift to driver Tariq Nadeem who picked him up from Piccadilly rail station on May 22, 2017. Later that same evening, he killed 22 people.

item.title: Millions face childcare crisis after Sadiq Khan calls for ALL schools to close from TODAY
item.description: Two Labour-run boroughs, Islington and Greenwich, have announced they plan to go rogue and end the term after lessons today, a mid a surge in Covid cases.

item.title: Muslim convert, 30, who stabbed prayer leader at London mosque is jailed for seven years
item.description: Daniel Horton admitted stabbing 70-year-old Raafat Maglad in front of shocked worshippers at London Central Mosque in February. He has been jailed for 7 years after admitting the offence.

item.title: Risk of catching coronavirus from a family member you live with is just 16.6%
item.description: In a new study from the University of Florida, researchers found 18% of symptomatic people infected with coronavirus spread the disease compared to 07% of those with no symptoms.

item.title: How England's North-South divide reversed
item.description: Burnley and South Tyneside were the only two northern areas to land in the top 50 most infected councils, Public Health England data shows, after the North has endured months of restrictions.

item.title: Met Police officer, 22, denies being a member of the banned neo-Nazi group National Action
item.description: Benjamin Hannam, 22, a probationary officer at the Metropolitan Police, denied three charges when he appeared at London's Old Bailey on Monday.

item.title: WHO chief Tedros Ghebreyseus is accused of aiding genocide in Ethiopia by nobel peace prize nominee
item.description: Economist David Steinman accused WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus of aiding genocide in Ethiopia and being one of three officials who directed security forces from 2013 to 2015.

item.title: Orgy with 50 naked people including prostitutes - held to celebrate a French woman's 28th birthday
item.description: Officers received calls about the noises coming from a holiday home - opposite a hospital - in the village of Saint-Mard in the province of Virton on Saturday night.

item.title: GPs in England will start offering Pfizer Covid jab from today
item.description: Practices in Kent and Merseyside claim they were informed by health bosses today that the first batch of doses won't arrive until sometime on Tuesday.

item.title: Mother, 33, gives inquest harrowing account of how midwives 'pushed on her stomach' to deliver baby
item.description: Charlotte Barnett told an inquest at Exeter's County Hall today that during labour at the North Devon District Hospital, her son Freddie was breached and his foot was delivered first.

item.title: Camilla 'will stay in the background' when Prince Charles becomes King, claims royal author
item.description: Camilla, who is based in Clarence House, London, with Prince Charles, will try not to be too much of a prominent figure when her husband ascends to the throne, royal author Clive Irving told the Express.

item.title: Coronavirus US: Ex-Facebook executive suggests vaccinated people should get coloured masks
item.description: Chamath Palihapitiya said in a tweet on Friday that everyone who gets the jab should 'all wear a mask of a special design or color'. However the idea sparked a backlash with many on social media.

item.title: Pound plunges against Dollar and Euro after annoucement London will move into Tier 3
item.description: The pound plunged this afternoon following the news that millions of Londoners would be moved into the higher Tier 3 band of coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: Mother fights to keep five-year-old daughter alive as medics tell court life support should go off
item.description: Doctors treating Pippa Knight at the Evelina Children's Hospital in London say life-support treatment should end. But her mother Paula Parfitt, 41, of Strood, Kent, said she 'will not give up'.

item.title: Naomi Campbell admits she buys hazmat suits in BULK as she hits back at claims she's 'stealing them'
item.description: The model, 50, who shocked fans with her elaborate in-flight cleaning regime, admits she has a subscription for a regular supply of suits, and insisting she buys them online 'fair and square.'

item.title: Anti-vax army clash with police outside Parliament in London
item.description: Anti-vaxxer protesters massed in London this lunchtime, just hours after it was all-but confirmed the capital will be put into Tier 3 coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: E-scooter legalisation calls grow as Halfords reports a sales bounce
item.description: The group said they grew by 184 per cent in the first half of the financial year, and is expecting a considerable number of e-scooters to be bought for Christmas.

item.title: Husky looks like she's wearing permanent glasses thanks to the unique fur pattern on her face
item.description: Tsuki the eight-month-old Siberian Husky looks as though she is wearing glasses thanks to her unique fur pattern. She lives in Leiria, Portugal, with owner Catarina Carvalho, 24.

item.title: Man who stabbed ex Wasps rugby player to death sentenced to life in a secure mental hospital
item.description: Allan Isichei, 69, was stabbed to death by Gurjeet Lall, 36, after arguing about spitting on the pavement as he was walking home from the pub in Southall, west London last year.

item.title: Panicky learner driver backs into parked car and writes it off after taking wrong turn
item.description: A young male learner driver in a white Audi A1 was captured on camera reversing into a parked black BMW M3. He smashed into the back of the car in Lincoln, East Mids., and wrote it off.

item.title: Singing to premature babies could reduce mothers' anxiety and help them bond with their child
item.description: Researchers from the University of Helsinki observed 24 mothers who sang or hummed to their baby while holding them during skin-to-skin contact in hospital.

item.title: Supermarket worker, 40, accused of stabbing wife and daughter to death
item.description: Marcin Zdun, 40, is charged with the murder of Aneta Zdun, 40, and 18-year-old Nikoleta Zdun. The women were pronounced dead at their home in Wessex Road, Salisbury, June 1 this year.

item.title: DPD delivery driver goes viral after footage is shared of him singing delivering Christmas parcel
item.description: Doorbell camera footage shows the DPD delivery driver Arnaud Helderal using the package as a drum as he made his way to the door in Bexleyheath, London.

item.title: Hamilton wants new £40m-a-year contract with Mercedes 'tied up by Christmas'
item.description: Talks between Hamilton and Mercedes stopped after the 35-year-old contracted Covid-19 earlier this month. Hamilton broke Michael Schumacher's record for most F1 race wins in October this year.

item.title: Shooting stars dazzle night skies as Geminid meteor shower peaks
item.description: The Geminid meteor shower takes place every year between December 4 and December 17, peaking between December 13 and December 14.
item.media:description: A shooting star can be seen during the Geminid meteor stream in the starry sky above the Kochelsee and the summit of the Herzogstand early Monday, Dec. 14, 2020 (Matthias Balk/dpa via AP)

item.title: Chinese ski resort is accused of beating its elderly sled dogs
item.description: Elderly dogs with serious facial wounds due to the hitting were made to wait for customers at Yabuli Ski Resort in north-western China's Heilongjiang Province, a source has revealed.

item.title: Former Liverpool manager Gerard Houllier dies aged 73
item.description: The Frenchman, who led the Reds to the FA Cup, League Cup and UEFA Cup treble in 2000-01, had a long history of medical problems.

item.title: Health: High blood pressure can speed up cognitive decline, study finds
item.description: Experts from Brazil monitored 7,000 adults - finding that even a short period of hypertension can impact such functions as memory, fluency and concentration.

item.title: Two staff die after Covid outbreak at M&S salad factory as bosses face calls to shut down plant
item.description: Two workers at a factory making Marks & Spencer salads have died following a coronavirus outbreak. Fresh food supplier Bakkavor has been hit so hard by the virus almost one in 10 positive

item.title: Photographs by Dimitri Bourriau show the haunting beauty of abandoned buildings
item.description: Welcome to the world French photographer Dimitri Bourriau loves to explore - the world of the abandoned. He has spent years roaming his home country and elsewhere to find relics to snap.

item.title: Shoppers surge by 20 per cent on Britain's High Streets as they rush to finish Christmas shopping
item.description: Millions headed out to snap up Christmas gifts amid fears of no deal Brexit and further Tier 3 lockdowns. It saw shoppers surge by 20% on High Streets and 26% in shopping centres.

item.title: Northerners gloat as Londoners learn they will be put into Tier Three
item.description: People in the North of England poked fun at Londoners today after it was revealed the capital will move into the highest tier of Covid-19 restrictions from Wednesday.

item.title: Mother discovers her toddler painted herself and the living room in nappy cream
item.description: Nicola Bowes, 28, who lives in Bolton, Greater Manchester with partner, Chris Sweeney, 27, was horrified to discover her toddler Isabella, three, had covered herself and their home in Sudocrem.

item.title: One in 11 people have now had Covid: At least 8.9% of England has coronavirus antibodies
item.description: The finding suggests more than 3.9million people in England have been infected with Covid-19, which is more than double the UK Government's official number of 1.5million.

item.title: The complex case of the 'most hated woman in Alaska''
item.description: A new four-part BBC Three documentary series, Accused: A Mother on Trial , explores the case of Ashley Ard, a 24-year-old from Virginia charged with second-degree murder after abandoning her baby.

item.title: M&S slipper review leaves shoppers in tears
item.description: A man, from the UK, who lost his leg five years ago, left shoppers in tears after he offered to donate the slipper he can never wear in the review section of the M&S product.

item.title: Boy, 9, raises over £30,000 for hospital where best friend, 10, is being treated for leukaemia
item.description: Hughie Higginson, 10, from Lancashire, who is battling leukaemia has called his best friend 'amazing' after committing to running 100km before Christmas to raise money for the hospital.

item.title: Move over John Lewis! Dutch festive ad is hailed the 'best this year'
item.description: Netherlands-based DocMorris' Christmas advert shows an elderly man, seemingly isolated by the coronavirus pandemic, training solo every day with a kettlebell to build up his strength.

item.title: French fishermen warn they will set up BLOCKADES in the Channel if there is a No Deal Brexit
item.description: French fishermen have warned they would block British vessels carrying vital goods from entering major ports such as Calais in the event of No Deal Brexit.

item.title: 'Racist' police gang crime unit's leaders were 'weak and permissive', inquiry hears
item.description: The serious organised crime team in Basingstoke, Hampshire, described as 'ableist, sexist, racist, transphobic and homophobic', were caught making abusive comments in a recording.

item.title: Bizarre moment Chinese man walks two rats on the street with wires tied to their mouths
item.description: The man is seen in trending footage walking the rodents with long strings attached to their mouths as leashes at a bustling market in southern China's Guangdong Province.

item.title: Lorraine Kelly has change of heart as she says Christmas should NOT be cancelled
item.description: The chat show host, 61, previously called for the UK government to cancel Christmas as she went into a passionate rant during an appearance on Good Morning Britain.

item.title: UK weather: 60mph winds are set to thrash UK this week
item.description: The Met Office has issued a weather warning for winds gusting at up to 60mph on Wednesday in South West England and Northern Ireland, amid fears over coastal roads being hit by spray.

item.title: Tanker anchored in Saudi is rammed by small 'bomb boat' packed with explosives in 'terror attack'
item.description: The Singapore-flagged BW Rhine was rocked by the explosion while moored at a fuel terminal in Jeddah in the early hours of the morning.

item.title: Connecticut boy, 6, racked up $16K bill on his mom's credit card playing video games on her iPad
item.description: George Johnson, 6, of Wilton, Connecticut, used mom Jessica's iPad to spend $16,000 on video game upgrades to Sonic Forces, when she wasn't watching. Now the family can't afford the mortgage.

item.title: Donald Trump is mocked over election loss in deepfake video by creators of South Park
item.description: Brought to life by Trey Parker and Matt Stone, the skit shows Trump sulking as he reads a reindeer story with a political twist to reflect his defeat to Joe Biden in November.

item.title: Almost 50 Brits to be given experimental nasal spray Covid-19 vaccine next month
item.description: New York-based company Codagenix said human studies of its vaccine, COVI-VAC, will begin on in London in the first week of January. Nasal spray vaccines are used to protect children from flu.

item.title: Chelsea boss Lampard wants 'level playing field' for stadiums with London set to go into Tier 3
item.description: The Blues have been able to welcome a small section of supporters back to Stamford Bridge in the last couple of weeks thanks to London enjoying Tier 2 status, which means that 2,000 are permitted.

item.title: Campaigners battle to stop 89-home estate being built next to Dorset manor Wolfeton House
item.description: Objectors including Historic England and the Thomas Hardy Society say plans for 89 homes near Wolfeton House in Dorchester would cause 'irreversible destruction' to the landscape.

item.title: Two Russian hooligans are jailed for beating English fan into coma leaving him paralysed at Euros
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: Pavel Kosov, a 33-year-old truck driver, was jailed for ten years for leading the attack on Andrew Bache, 55, ahead of England's opening match in Marseille.

item.title: Private school pupil killed his mother before dialling 999 to tell police they should arrest him
item.description: Rowan Thompson stabbed his mother Joanna Thompson to death 118 times in Hambledon, Hampshire in July of last year and was found dead in a secure mental health facility this October.

item.title: Royal fans claim Prince Louis is 'the spitting image' of Michael Middleton
item.description: Royals fans have gone wild over Prince Louis' striking resemblance to Kate Middleton's father, Michael, 71. Taking to the comments section, one person penned: 'They're like peas in a pod.'

item.title: Wales hints it could AXE Christmas 'bubbles' amid alarm at surge in Covid cases
item.description: Welsh Health minister Vaughan Gething refused to rule out a rethink saying the nation's government could need to 'make choices to keep people safe'.

item.title: Chaos as banks shut expats' accounts as end of Brexit transition looms
item.description: Thousands of British expats who live on the European continent are facing banking chaos as UK lenders scramble to prepare for life outside the EU and cancel accounts.

item.title: 'Drug dealer' accidentally showed police video of cannabis farm while using Google Translate
item.description: Northumbria Police stopped a Mercedes near Sunderland and detected a strong smell of cannabis. While trying to explain himself, the occupant opened a video of the farm instead of translation app.

item.title: Police charge boy, 14, with murder as 12-year-old victim is named
item.description: The body of Roberts Buncis was found on grassland in Fishtoft, Lincolnshire, at around 10.22am on Saturday. He would've turned 13 today, it has emerged.

item.title: How to wrap the perfect Christmas present
item.description: Gift wrapping experts from Hippychick.com have come together to help you wrap your Christmas presents of all shapes and sizes with a handy step-by-step guide.

item.title: Mike and 'very playful and cheeky' Zara Tindall's marriage is 'stronger than ever', sources claim
item.description: Zara Tindall's, 39, marriage to rugby ace Mike, 41, is 'stronger than ever' as they prepare for the birth of their third child, sources told The Telegraph. The couple live in Gloucester.

item.title: Meghan Markle puts on a very glamorous display in an unseen 2016 snap
item.description: Meghan Markle, 39, puts on a stylish display in an unseen 2016 snap with Lizzie Cundy and Phones4U billionaire John Caudwell's ex-wife Claire Caudwell.

item.title: Amazon and Sky agree TV partnership to host each other's apps
item.description: The deal means customers in the UK and Ireland can watch content from across both platforms in one place for the first time over the festive period.

item.title: Zayn Malik 'misses his sister Waliyha's wedding to her ex-convict partner'
item.description: The former One Directioner, 27, was nowhere to be seen snaps from his sister's nuptials. Waliyha, 22, is said to have married ex-convict Junaid Khan, 24.

item.title: How Meghan Markle swapped dramatic makeup for a 'pared back natural' look
item.description: Makeup artist Lisa Little told FEMAIL the Duchess of Sussex, 39, matched her mauve eyeshadow with flowers and ditched the Hollywood glamour to show her softer side' during CNN appearance.

item.title: Eamonn Holmes slammed for making 'irresponsible' joke about sharing medication
item.description: Eamonn Holmes, 61, has been slammed for making an 'irresponsible' joke about sharing medication on This Morning during Dr Philippa Kaye's medical segment discussion on out of date medication.

item.title: Queen wraps up warm for a horse ride around grounds of Windsor Castle
item.description: Her Majesty, 94, sported a silk headscarf and beige trench coat for a leisurely ride around her home accompanied by an aide.

item.title: The party pad where EVERYTHING must go!
item.description: James and Sophie Perkins, who own Aynhoe Park, in Oxfordshire, are putting the contents of their ostentatious stately home up for auction with Dreweatts next month.

item.title: AstraZeneca 'would have done trials differently' if it had been in charge of Oxford's vaccine
item.description: Dr Mene Pangalos, the pharmaceutical giant's vice president, said there was 'no doubt' that British firm AstraZeneca would have done the trials 'a little bit differently' if they had been managing them.

item.title: YouTube, Google and Gmail all CRASH as users complain of issues
item.description: The majority of Google's billions of customers are believed to have been affected by the mass outage.

item.title: Jacinda Ardern hits back at Greta Thunberg after she slammed nation's climate emergency pledge
item.description: The Swedish teenager, 17, took aim at a fresh New Zealand pledge to reduce emissions within the pubic sector, which would effect less than one per cent of the country's carbon footprint.

item.title: China has two panda subspecies: One looks 'more like bears' and the other 'resembles cats'
item.description: The two subspecies live in the south-western Sichuan Province and north-western Shaanxi Province. They have not interacted with each other for some 300,000 years, according to China's state TV.

item.title: Prince Andrew is pictured in Windsor amid proof he misled Emily Maitlis
item.description: Sources have confirmed the Queen's second son was indeed a guest at the paedophile tycoon's Manhattan home in April 2001, raising questions about his other recollections of the time.

item.title: Neighbour has the perfect one word answer to next door's traffic-stopping Christmas illuminations
item.description: Malcolm Finch, from London, placed a sign on his home which spelled 'ditto' in lights and pointed in the direction of his neighbour's house which was covered from top to bottom in Christmas lights.

item.title: Ursula von der Leyen fuels hopes of Brexit breakthrough
item.description: EU commission president Ursula von der Leyen said the discussions were in the 'very last mile' amid claims that both sides have given ground on so-called 'level playing field' rules.

item.title: Fears fresh food supply chain 'won't cope' with No Deal disruption
item.description: Former head of Sainsbury's Justin King warned that processes at the border are not ready for the end of the transition period - and will require 'goodwill' from the EU to 'cope'.

item.title: New York concert shooting: Video reveals NYPD confronting gunman
item.description: This is the moment NYPD officers fatally shot a man shouting 'kill me' on the steps of St John the Divine Cathedral in New York around 3.45pm Sunday, after he opened fire at a Christmas carol concert.

item.title: Which FTSE 100 companies paid the largest dividends in 2020 despite cuts?
item.description: British American Tobacco is going to be this year's biggest dividend payer, according to analysts..

item.title: Donald Trump's niece claims attention is 'like a drug' to the President due to his upbringing
item.description: Speaking in a new discovery+ documentary, Donald Trump: A Faking It Special, Mary Trump suggests her estranged uncle lies 'constantly and relentlessly'.

item.title: Jamie Carragher slams Lord Sugar after he used Gerard Houllier's death to take dig at Piers Morgan
item.description: Jamie Carragher hit out at Lord Sugar on Monday morning, calling him a 'f***ing idiot' on Twitter after using his tribute to Gerard Houllier to have a dig at Piers Morgan.

item.title: Masked machete thugs beat shopkeeper 'like a dog' in sickening attack that left him with broken leg
item.description: Kumar Manuvelpillai, 50, was assaulted by two men as he locked up for the night outside the Nila convenience store in Rock Ferry, near Birkenhead.

item.title: Robotics: Kitchen assistant will cook 5,000 recipes from scratch - and even do the washing up after
item.description: Developed by UK-based Moley Robotics, the cooking automaton has two dextrous hands and was modelled to mimic the 2011 MasterChef winner, Tim Anderson.

item.title: Horse owner is forced to change filly's name from 'Jungle Bunny' to 'Jungle Bells' amid racism storm
item.description: British Horseracing Authority officials have apologised and made a horse called 'Jungle Bunny' change its identity - despite the owner's family insisting it was named after a computer game.

item.title: Millwall move to BAN Sky Sports from screening home Championship clash with Watford
item.description: Sky Sports carried a story on their website in the lead up to the game against QPR, reporting that Millwall's players would still take a knee - despite the two clubs saying that wouldn't happen.

item.title: Netflix says it will increase diversity to 'be a force for good' as it announces new shows
item.description: Netflix said it would 'amplify' British writing and film-making talent and increase diversity across the streming service as it announced a host of new shows, including content from writer Bisha K Ali.

item.title: Hong Kong art student who spent two years 'upskirting' women on the London Underground spared jail
item.description: Wui Tung Colin Chan, 22, was caught covertly filming underneath women's clothing after a victim performed a citizen's arrest on him at Victoria Underground Station in March this year.

item.title: GCHQ spies probe whether hackers stole UK government secrets after cyber attack on US agencies
item.description: National Cyber Security Centre is assessing the UK impact of the US cyber attack which targeted the hugely popular SolarWInds software used by government agencies worldwide.

item.title: Bespoke gift maker reveals the Christmas presents she's made for high-end clients
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Debbie Wingham, who is based in the UK, has made a name for herself designing lavish outfits, accessories, artworks and novelty gifts for wealthy clients all over the world.

item.title: Two 50-stone grizzly bears attack each other
item.description: The images of the fight were captured on the Tahumming River in Canada's British Colombia by retired firefighter and amateur wildlife photographer Wayne Duke.

item.title: Married personal trainer is now engaged to another woman after meeting her in one of her classes
item.description: Personal trainer Saskia Michalski, 27, from Hamburg, married husband Marcin in 2017 and hadn't considered polyamory until she met Lui Michalski, 27, and fell in love.

item.title: US F15 fighter jets avoid crashing into gliders over English countryside, report reveals
item.description: The pilots of two F15 Strike Eagle fighter jets had to take emergency measures to avoid a mid-air collision and missed the gliders by just 150m on August 11 this year near Chatteris, Cambridgeshire.

item.title: Holidaymaker, 34, wins court battle against travel giant Lufthansa
item.description: Lufthansa were ordered to refund Maxime Audet and wife Veronique £1,058.41 after Central London County Court ruled the airline had shown no evidence the spelling error was made by the couple.

item.title: Matthew Wright is ridiculed for his lockdown locks as This Morning viewers question his mullet
item.description: Presenter Matthew Wright, 55, from London, caused a stir online today as This Morning viewers were left distracted by his hairdo, which featured a tiny ponytail at the back.

item.title: British researcher jailed for nine years in Iran for his 'subversive' work on FGM and child marriage
item.description: Kameel Ahmady was also fined 600,000 euros (£550,000) - the sum Iranian authorities said he received for his research from institutions accused of seeking to topple Iran's Islamic government.

item.title: Australia's Byron Bay beach 'disappears' in extreme storm
item.description: The Main Beach at Byron Bay, a tourist destination in New South Wales, was washed away as trees and a concrete walkway collapsed into the sea amid cyclonic conditions.

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer defends UK honours system after Kate Green criticism
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer today slapped down shadow education secretary Kate Green after she labelled the UK honours system 'divisive' and 'offensive'.

item.title: Stephanie Browitt shares recovery update more than one year after White Island volcano tragedy
item.description: Stephanie Browitt, 24, was touring the island with her 21-year-old sister Krystal and their father Paul when the volcano erupted off the coast of New Zealand on December 9, 2019.

item.title: Homeless deaths rise for fifth year in a row
item.description: Figures from the ONS show there were an estimated 778 deaths of homeless people registered in 2019 - an increase of 7.2 per cent from 2018, and the highest number since 2013.

item.title: Could CIRCULAR runways take off? Aerospace tests show circle designs would increase capacity
item.description: Circular runways could revolutionise commercial aviation while increasing the capacity of airports by 2050, according to Henk Hesselink, an engineer at Royal Netherlands Aerospace Centre (NLR).

item.title: Smart ring that constantly measures your temperature could provide an early warning of Covid-19
item.description: Experts from the University of California and MIT Lincoln Lab studied data on 50 people who owned sensor rings and had had Covid-19 before the study.

item.title: Amir Khan's wife Faryal Makhdoom 'lost her sense of taste' but jetted off to Dubai
item.description: Faryal Makhdoom took to social media about not having a sense of taste - one of the main Covid-19 symptoms - before jetting off to Dubai.

item.title: Prince Carl Philip and Princess Sofia of Sweden expecting third child
item.description: Prince Carl Philip of Sweden and his wife Princess Sofia have announced they are expecting their third child together. They already have sons Alexander, four, and Gabriel, three.

item.title: Government gives green light on Sizewell C nuclear power station
item.description: Sizewell C, based in Suffolk, would be a near replica of Hinkley Point C in Somerset and could generate around 7 per cent of the UK's power demand when it comes into service.

item.title: Police arrest man and woman for murder after newborn baby was found dead in back garden
item.description: A member of the public had discovered the body of the newborn baby in a back garden in Weston-super-Mare, Somerset on Saturday and police launched an urgent appeal at the weekend.

item.title: Workers riot at India iPhone factory over shifts
item.description: Cars were flipped over and set on fire while glass panels were smashed with rods and lights, fans and CCTV cameras were torn down during the rioting on Saturday near India's IT hub, Bangalore.

item.title: Coronavirus is 'out of control' in Germany, minister says
item.description: Peter Altmaier admitted that 'the less intrusive measures were not enough' after Germany was forced to shut down shops and schools over Christmas following six weeks of partial measures.

item.title: Swaziland Prime Minister is the first world leader to die of Covid-19
item.description: Ambrose Dlamini, 52, tested positive for the disease in mid-November but was said to be feeling well and asymptomatic.

item.title: Spitting feathers! Photographer captures furious looking nuthatch doing impression of Angry Birds
item.description: Wildlife photographer Will Hall, 26, was in Hampshire, when he spotted the nuthatch zooming towards him with a fiercely determined look on its face prompting him to grab his camera.

item.title: Cher reveals a man tried to KILL her while she was performing in a play on Broadway in 1982
item.description: The iconic singer, 74, spoke candidly about the terrifying ordeal with The Guardian's G2 Magazine on Monday, saying fans came to her rescue after she was dragged into an alley by the person.

item.title: Schoolgirl, 9, slips over 40 TIMES as she struggles to walk up a frozen street in Ukraine
item.description: Maria Moiseyenko, nine, showed determination as she tried to make her way up an icy street in Kiev, Ukraine, slipping over around 40 times. A man stopped to help her but left when she fell again.

item.title: Two bikini-clad women are caught twerking in a public fountain in Spain
item.description: The two women are under investigation for breaking the curfew, failing to wear masks and bathing in the public fountain in Seville, while at least was allegedly also seen at a party in a nearby flat.

item.title: Remdesivir 'could be beneficial for some patients', doctors reveal
item.description: University of Cambridge researchers studied a 31-year-old man with Covid-9 who also has a genetic condition, XLA, which prevents him from making antibodies.

item.title: Couple aged in their eighties rack up over 1 million views
item.description: Joseph, 88, and Sylvia Dolan, 82, from Doncaster, have become a sensation on TikTok, after their daughter Jackie became concerned about them not getting out and seeing people.

item.title: At least three dead and five still missing after container ship sank following a collision in China
item.description: The 12,788-tonne Chinese ship carrying 650 containers clashed with a foreign cargo boat at about 11.30pm local time (3.30pm GMT) on Sunday on the Yangtze River estuary near Shanghai.

item.title: Two asylum seekers go AWOL every week from UK's first migrant camp
item.description: Napier Barracks in Folkestone, Kent was turned into an 'assessment and dispersal facility' for migrants, with 400 arriving in September at the height of the migrant crisis.

item.title: Boyfriend stabbed mother-of-one twice in motiveless breakfast time attack
item.description: Joanne Smallwood has said how the April attack in her Manchester home had left her with feelings of 'self-blame' and that she now has symptoms of PTSD and is afraid to leave her home.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle 'will be seen more and in a different way' in 2021, sources claim
item.description: The public will 'see more of the Duke, 36, and Duchess of Sussex, 39, in 2021' and 'in a way which is more in line with who they are' than working royal roles, sources told Vanity Fair's Katie Nicholl.

item.title: Family turn OFF festive display after abuse of autistic daughter
item.description: Dad Darren Lucas, 54, said neighbours sparked a row over parking along their street in Govilon, near Abergavenny, South Wales. They hurled abuse and reduced his autistic daughter to tears.

item.title: Crook targets wheelchair-bound pensioner to grab at cashpoint
item.description: CCTV shows the OAP, in her 90s, sat beside an ATM in north London while a second woman - who appears to be her carer - withdraws money for them.

item.title: Deradicalisation of jihadis does NOT work, warns terror watchdog
item.description: Jonathan Hall QC, the head of the terrorism watchdog, today said offenders were 'deceptive' towards probation staff and would say what they wanted to hear in mentoring meetings.

item.title: Rishi Sunak extends Covid bailouts for No Deal
item.description: Rishi Sunak is preparing to extend the use of the coronavirus bailout scheme to help British businesses hit by a No Deal Brexit.

item.title: Britain's drivers have been hit by pothole menace even harder this year
item.description: A large study by the RAC published today shows that 38 per cent of UK motorists listed the poor state of council-maintained local roads as the biggest concern, up from 33 per cent last year.

item.title: Moment three women trade punches and kicks in brutal brawl outside Oxford Street pub
item.description: Shocking video footage reveals the moment the brutal brawl broke out, as two women can be seen repeatedly hitting and kicking the third one.

item.title: UK weather: Bookmakers hint Britain could be in for a White Christmas
item.description: The UK has not seen snow fall on Christmas Day since 2015 when it was observed at a tenth of weather stations, which itself was five years after widespread flurries fell in 2010.

item.title: Hairdresser with alopecia proudy shows off her bald head
item.description: Victoria Morgan, 41, from Burntwood, who grew up with long black hair, began to experience extreme hair loss after falling pregnant, and admits she initially felt like 'life wasn't worth living'.

item.title: People reveal the devastating impact of having a homeless family member
item.description: Among the eye-opening stories shared to a Whisper thread from around the world is that of a man whose wife left him because he was trying to support his homeless mother.

item.title: Couple who separated in 2019 reunited during lockdown
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Emma, 40 and Dean James, from Bradford, who separated in 2019, said lockdown got them back together after they moved in together to look after their five-year-old son.

item.title: Peter Murrell's evidence over Alex Salmond sexual harassment probe is 'unravelling', says Tory MSP
item.description: Tory MSP Murdo Fraser has said Mr Murrell is going to 'great lengths to cover up the SNP's failings' as the Holyrood inquiry into their handling of complaints about Alex Salmond continues

item.title: Santa gives Belgian care home Covid-19: 75 are infected after 'superspreader' visited residents
item.description: The volunteer dressed as Sinterklaas was welcomed in to spread Christmas cheer among the 150 residents of the Hemelrijck care home in Mol, Antwerp, last week.

item.title: Prancing on ice! Phoebe the playful boxer dog shows off her hilarious skating skills
item.description: Phoebe the boxer dog was practicing her skills with an ice block in Aurora, Colorado, on December 5. Footage shows the playful dog pushing a block of ice along the ground with her front paws.

item.title: Meghan Markle praises the 'quiet heroes' feeding the hungry amid pandemic
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex praised key workers and volunteers, while sitting on a bench apparently in the grounds of the £11million ($14million) California mansion she shares with Prince Harry.

item.title: Gangster Tony Sales reveals how he got away with stealing £30M in new book
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: New book The Big Con documents how Greenwich-born gangster Tony Sales, 46, spent 30 years stealing Rolexes, diamonds and luxury cars to fund his own extravagant lifestyle.

item.title: Jill Biden hits back at 'misogynistic' WSJ op-ed writer
item.description: Jill Biden on Sunday night responded to a controversy which began on Friday when the Wall Street Journal published a piece by Joseph Epstein (right) mocking her use of the title doctor.

item.title: Is my mother entitled to claim her state pension when on end of life care?
item.description: My mother's funding for end of life care is 100 per cent and no top-ups are requested by Mum or the county council. Is she still entitled to receive her state pension or do I need to stop this payment?

item.title: 'Oh my heart': Heartwarming moment daughter surprises her 97-year-old mother with a rescue dog
item.description: Eunice, 97, from the US, was filled with joy as her daughter Debbie surprised her with a new dog, seven-year-old rescue Daisy. The elderly woman and the pup share a sweet moment as she says 'oh my heart'.

item.title: Prostitute wins six-figure pay out after suing for sexual harassment in New Zealand
item.description: The payment is to compensate the sex worker 'for both emotional harm and lost earnings', according to New Zealand's human rights commission.

item.title: Rightmove: House prices forecast to climb another 4% in 2021
item.description: Average asking prices rose by 6.6 per cent in the year to December to £319,945, although they declined slightly over the past month, Rightmove said.

item.title: Family's 150,000-bulb house decorations is country's biggest residential display
item.description: Jeremy and Mandy Voakes and their children, from Morecambe, have put together the biggest residential Christmas lights display of the UK, with 150,000 bulbs that take six months to build up.

item.title: People share their most anxiety-inducing photos
item.description: People from across the globe have shared their most anxiety-inducing photographs. The snaps, which have been collated online by The Fashion Ball, include someone sitting on a cliff edge.

item.title: How to get your dream bum in 2021: Personal trainer Sophie Allen shares her secrets
item.description: A personal trainer who changed her training and diet to sculpt her dream physique has shared her secrets for getting your ideal body this summer. Sophie Allen, 31, from Sydney, shared how.

item.title: Mystery as hundreds of precious jewellery items wash up on beach in poor Venezuelan fishing village
item.description: The village's 2,000 residents have joined the search for treasure, and have raked the few square feet of sand in Guaca, Venezuela.

item.title: Why you should never mix old and new batteries - and how to extend battery life
item.description: A little-known danger involving batteries has been revealed as millions use them to power twinkling fairy lights and interactive children's toys this Christmas.
